result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jakeb J Kirk

records.addlTxt: Any cash bond posted for Defendant shall be used for fines, costs and restitution pursuant to WI STAT 969.13(5). No verbally abusive contact with EAS or her residence, no contact with the minor children in the residence. Defendant is not to consume or possess alcohol.  Do not enter premises where alcohol is primary business, any bars taverns or liquor stores or any other establishment where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol. No discussion of the case with the victim.
Adjourned initial appearance on November 29, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

1:58 PM Defendant Jakeb J Kirk appeared by video.  Prosecuting attorney Emily Nelson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  PD Attorney Kaitlin Dippolito appeared in person.   DE does qualify for PD but at this time they are unable to locate an attorney.   PD needs additional time.  INIT adjourned to 11/29/22 at 3:30 PM.    State informed the Court that the victim has completed the course at Embrace.  State moved to amend bond to no abusive contact.  No obj.  Victim present in court.   Court AMENDED bond to allow contact but contact cannot be verbally abusive contact.  In additional no discussion of the case with the victim.   All other conditions on current bond remain unchanged.  Adj. 2:01 PM.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 29, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on November 29, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

records.descr: Order on motion to seal/redact court record

records.addlTxt: Any cash bond posted for Defendant shall be used for fines, costs and restitution pursuant to WI STAT 969.13(5). No contact with EAS or her residence, no contact with the minor children in the residence. Defendant is not to consume or possess alcohol.  Do not enter premises where alcohol is primary business, any bars taverns or liquor stores or any other establishment where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.

1:11 PM Defendant Jakeb J Kirk appeared by video.  Attorney Ellen Anderson appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Public Defendant Attorney Dustin Rockow appeared via video.   The matter is set for a Bail/Bond hearing.  State requested a $1500 cash bond with conditions DE  have no contact with EAS or her residence, no unsupervised contact with children of EAS (supervision by an adult over age 25 approved by EAS), and Defendant is not to consume or possess alcohol.  Do not enter premises where alcohol is primary business, any bars taverns or liquor stores or any other establishment where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.     Attorney Rockow argued for a high signature bond with a promise he will show for all future court hearings and will abide by all nonmonetary conditions.   Court ORDERED a $1500 cash bond, no contact with EAS or her residence, and no contact with the minor children in the residence and condition Defendant is not to consume or possess alcohol.  Do not enter premises where alcohol is primary business, any bars taverns or liquor stores or any other establishment where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.   INIT set for 11/1/22 at 1:30 PM.  Adj. 1:21 PM
Initial appearance scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Initial appearance on November 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
